job_title: in Glens Falls, NY
pros: The best reasons to work here are the team with which one  is directly involved. Everyone wants to work hard and is dedicated to helping take care of our patients in the best way possible. If allowed to do what we do best, and with truly visionary leadership at the helm to manage the workings of the the system, we could really be a fine institution.
cons: The resources of this, like so many organizations, are diverted to the top management salaries and "administration" costs instead of where they would be best invested- in the investment of the services which result in income or which are involved with patient safety. Managment then must cut out the essential services for performance excellence and growth in order to fix the bottom line instead of looking at the long term investment picture and listening to unit managment about what is needed to run departments effectively with growth, safety, and job satisfaction in mind.

review_title: It was a short but wonderful experience. I learned a great deal in a short period.
job_title: Lab Specimen Processing Tech in Glens Falls, NY
pros: Glens Falls Hospital is one of the few hospitals I know that is willing to give people with little to no experience a chance to learn. I was one of those cases. It was a great environment, everyone was friendly and people actually cared.
cons: There were some days with a lot of downtime and then other days where the work would not stop. Workload is not consistent. There's also a lot of miscommunication between upper management and workers as to how things are supposed to be done.

review_title: Worked there for more than more than 20 years as a department manager.
